condition.name: Wounded
entries: While you have the Wounded(X) condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Life Leak
entries: At the start of your turn you loses X amount of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Painfullness
entries: You have the {@condition Pain|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Selfcare
entries: If you taken an any of following action:{@action Dash}, {@action Attack}, {@action Jump} or trying to make Strength({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. you loses X amount of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

condition.name: Pain
entries: While you have the Pain condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Weakness and Inattention
entries: You have a disadvantage on any mental ability checks and physical savingthrows

condition.name: On Fire
entries: While you have the On Fire(X) condition, you experience the following effects.

entries.name: Burning
entries: At the start of your turn you get X amount of Fire damage.

entries.name: Painfullness
entries: You have the {@condition Pain|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Warmed up
entries: You have the {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to cold Damage and {@condition Freeze|XPHB} condition and {@variantrule Vulnerabilyity|XPHB} to Fire damage and {@condition On Fire|XPHB} condition.

variantrule.name: Improved Critical Hit
entries: If you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, you score a Critical Hit, and the attack hits regardless of any modifiers or the target's AC. A Critical Hit lets you maximize you damage roll and roll extra dice for the attack's damage against the target, add them together. Then add any relevant modifiers.

variantrule.name: Revised Conditions
entries: A condition is a temporary game state. The definition of a condition says how it affects its recipient, and various rules define how to end a condition. This glossary defines these conditions:
A condition doesn't stack with itself; a recipient either has a condition or doesn't. The {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} condition is an exception to that rule.

spell.name: Mass Command
entries: You speak a one-word command up to a six creature you can see within range. The targets must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on them next turn. Choose the command from these options:

items.name: Approach
entries: The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

items.name: Drop
entries: The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

items.name: Flee
entries: The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

items.name: Grovel
entries: The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition and then ends its turn.

items.name: Halt
entries: On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can affect three additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Mooncloak
entries: For the duration, moonlight fills a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you with {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB}. While in that area, you and your allies have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold, Lightning, and Radiant damage.
While the spell lasts, you can use one of the following options, ending the spell immediately:

items.name: Liberation
entries: When you fail a saving throw to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to succeed on the save instead.

items.name: Respite
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you or an ally within the area regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 4d10} plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bouncer makes three attacks, using Rapier or Hand Crossbow in any combination.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 8}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Poison damage.

action.name: Smoke Bomb (1/Day)
entries: The bouncer throws a bomb to a point it can see within 30 feet of itself. {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of the spy's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The bouncer takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Poison damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The Braggart takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mahadi's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Mahadi can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless he wishes to be. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Mahadi's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mahadi makes four claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it's a creature. The curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The acrobat casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the acrobat is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acrobat makes four attacks, each of which can be an Unarmed Strike or a Dart attack. It can also use
Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: The acrobat teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it leaves and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Fiery Leap
entries: The firerunner's long jump is up to 30 feet and their high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start. The first time a firerunner lands after a jump on their turn, each creature within 5 feet of them takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The firerunner makes two Fire Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Fire Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Blaze Sprint {@recharge 5}
entries: The firerunner moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Each creature they come within 5 feet of during this movement must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if had a {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 30/120 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if had a {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Smoke Bomb (1/Day)
entries: The artist throws a bomb to a point it can see within 30 feet of itself. {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of the spy's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

bonus.name: Feint
entries: The artist takes the Feint action, target should make a wisdom saving throw or artist gain advantage on next attack against target. It works only in melee.

bonus.name: Helpful
entries: The sidekick is adept at giving well-timed assistance; the sidekick can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The sidekick's agility or quick thinking allows it to act speedily. On its turn in combat, it can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage} , or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

action.name: Rapier+1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry.
entries: {@actTrigger} The noble is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The noble adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: Yanush has a {@feat Lucky} feat and {@i 2 Luck Points} from it. He can use them by the next rules:
{@bold Advantage.} When you roll a {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can spend {@i 1 Luck Point} to give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the roll.
{@bold Disadvantage.} When a creature rolls a {@dice d20} for an attack roll against you, you can spend {@i 1 Luck Point} to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on that roll.

trait.name: Tools
entries: Yanush has proficiency with {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}, {@item Jeweler's Tools|XPHB} and {@item Painter's Supplies|XPHB}

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The warrior has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Savage Attacker
entries: You've trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon's damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

trait.name: Tough
entries: Your Hit Point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your character level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a character level thereafter, your Hit Point maximum increases by an additional 2 Hit Points.

trait.name: Martial Role: Attacker
entries: The sidekick gains a +2 bonus to all attack rolls.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind
entries: The sidekick can use a bonus action on its turn to regain hit points equal to {@damage 1d10+2}. Once it uses this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can use it again.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

trait.name: Savage Attacker
entries: You've trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon's damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

trait.name: Alert
entries: You gain the following benefits.
{@b Initiative Proficiency.} When you roll Initiative, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the roll.

{@b Initiative Swap.} Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can swap your Initiative with the Initiative of one willing ally in the same combat. You can't make this swap if you or the ally has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.
Soldiers are found in many of Ravnica's guilds. The soldier stat block represents a typical member of the rank and file, though weaponry and armor can vary.

reaction.name: Defender
entries: The sidekick can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll of a creature within 5 feet of it whose target isn't the sidekick, provided the sidekick can see the attacker.

bonus.name: Second Wind
entries: The sidekick can use a bonus action on its turn to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + its level in this class. Once it uses this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can use it again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist makes Two Pact Dagger attacks.

action.name: Pact Dagger
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d8}) Fire damage.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke
entries: The cultist casts {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
At will: {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB}

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Pact Blade
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Demonic Ichor
entries: Thalik drinks vial with demonic ichor and start the transformation ({@spell Polymorph}) to {@creature Goat-Man|ToB1-2023} demon which ends at the end of his next turn.

bonus.name: Spiritual Weapon (2/Day)
entries: The cultist casts the {@spell Spiritual Weapon|XPHB} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
2/day: {@spell Spiritual Weapon|XPHB}

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wolf makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two Longsword or Javelin attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage

trait.name: Command
entries: Sergeant can each turn instead one of his attacks command his ally to attack as a reaction. That attack has an Advantage.

monster.name: Summoned Amara(SL:2)
languages: speaks and understands the languages you speak

trait.name: Spiritual Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the companion to 0 hit points, it can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit or necrotic damage. On a success, the companion drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Radiant Absorption
entries: Whenever the Amara is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt. Amara can't regain hit points from any  another source.

trait.name: Celestial Spiritual Essense
entries: Amara doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. Also sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Spirit Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Flame
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 60 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Divine Aid.
entries: The priest casts, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
1/day: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure wounds|XPHB}

bonus.name: Divine Aid
entries: The priest casts can cast some spells using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
1/day: {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability(DC: 12, Attack Bonus: {@hit 4}):

spellcasting.name: Divine Aid
headerEntries: The priest casts {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, or {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Flame
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 4}, range 60 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) Radiant damage.

Priest acolytes have great faith but modest magical skill. Some might be trainees in religious organizations or soldiers in zealous armies, while others are faith leaders in small communities or wanderers on pilgrimages.

entries.name: Priests
entries: {@i Arbiters of the Mortal and the Divine}

Priests harness the power of faith to work miracles. These religious adherents are as diverse as the faiths they follow. Some obey gods and their servants, while others live by age-old creeds. Belief guides priests' actions and their magic, which they use to shape the world in line with their ideologies.
Roll on or choose a result from the Priest Roles table to inspire different sorts of priests.

entries.caption: Priest Roles
rows: An ascetic who keeps wicked spirits at bay.
An elder who speaks for the dead.
An exorcist who hunts wicked spirits.
A follower of a god no one has heard of.
A mediator and teacher of traditional ways.
A philosopher devoted to a concept, multiversal view, or plane of existence.
The reincarnation of an ancient faith leader.
A ritualist who uses tinctures and performances to access the divine.
A shaman whose medicines ease many ills.
A zealot who wages war for a divine cause.

entries: Shining One, light my hours. Enkindle my soul, and inspire my deeds. Chase the shadows from my path, and let me walk in your brilliance.

bonus.name: Divine Aid
entries: The priest casts Sanctuary, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
1/day: {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB},

entries: The priestcan cast some spells using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
2/day: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure wounds|XPHB}

3/day: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Warding bond|XPHB}

bonus.name: Divine Aid
entries: The priest casts cast some spells using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
3/day: {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser restoration}

monster.name: Summoned Amara(SL:5)
languages: speaks and understands the languages you speak

trait.name: Spiritual Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the companion to 0 hit points, it can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit or necrotic damage. On a success, the companion drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Spirit Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) Radiant damage. If Amara hits an undead, fiend, or fey, then its speed is reduced by 10 feet and it cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Radiant Flame
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 60 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 5d6}) Radiant damage. If Amara hits an undead, fiend, or fey, then its speed is reduced by 10 feet and it cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Divine Aid.
entries: The priest casts some spells, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
4/day: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Warding bond|XPHB}

entries: The priest casts some spells, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
6/day: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Warding bond|XPHB}, {@spell Revivify|XPHB},

entries: The priest casts cast some spells using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
6/day: {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Mass Healing Word|XPHB}

monster.name: Summoned Amara(SL:8)
languages: speaks and understands the languages you speak

trait.name: Spiritual Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the companion to 0 hit points, it can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit or necrotic damage. On a success, the companion drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Celestial Spiritual Essense
entries: Amara doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. Also sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet. An aura radiates from you in a 30-foot Emanation. While in the aura, you and your allies have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end effects that include the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Radiant Absorption.
entries: Whenever the Amara is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt. Amara can't regain hit points from any another source.

action.name: Spirit Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 7d4}) Radiant damage. If Amara hits an undead, fiend, or fey, then its speed is reduced by 10 feet and it cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Radiant Flame
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 10}, range 60 ft. {@h}27 ({@damage 8d6}) Radiant damage. If Amara hits an undead, fiend, or fey, then its speed is reduced by 10 feet and it cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Divine Aid.
entries: The priest casts some spells, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
7/day: {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Cure wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Warding bond|XPHB}, {@spell Revivify|XPHB},

bonus.name: Divine Aid
entries: The priest casts cast some spells using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
7/day: {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB}, {@spell Lesser restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Mass Healing Word|XPHB}

monster.name: Zephyr Deity of the East Wind

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Zephir casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Elemental Restoration
entries: If the Zephir dies outside the Elemental Plane of Air or Arborea, its body dissolves into mist, and it gains a new body in {@dice 1d4} days, reviving with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} somewhere on the Arborea.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Zephir has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Wishes
entries: The Zephir known the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell. He can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the djinni can understand. If the djinni casts the spell for the creature, the djinni suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the djinni has cast it three times, the djinni can't do so again for 365 days.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Zephir fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Zephir makes three attacks, using Storm Blade or Storm Bolt in any combination.

action.name: Storm Blade
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 13}, reach 5 feet. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) Slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Lightning damage.

action.name: Storm Bolt
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 13}, range 120 feet. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) Thunder damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Create Whirlwind
entries: The Zephir conjures a whirlwind at a point it can see within 120 feet. The whirlwind fills a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} centered on that point. The whirlwind lasts until the djinni's {@status Concentration|XPHB} on it ends. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 20 feet at the start of each of its turns.

Whenever the whirlwind enters a creature's space or a creature enters the whirlwind, that creature is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave str} {@dc 18} (a creature makes this save only once per turn, and the djinni is unaffected). {@actSaveFail} While in the whirlwind, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and moves with the whirlwind. At the start of each of its turns, the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Thunder damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Bolster
entries: The Zephir gains 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}, and the Zephir and each ally within 30 feet of it gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the end of the his next turn. The Zephir can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Shockwave of Glory
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the Zephir. {@actSaveFail} 27 ({@damage 6d8}) Force damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The Zephir can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Smite
entries: The Zephir makes one Storm Bolt attack.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Lulu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Lulu's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lulu makes one Hoof attacks and one Horn attack.

action.name: Hoof
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Lulu casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hellwasp's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hellwasp makes three attacks: one with its sting and two with its sword talons.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus {@h}22 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage, or {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus {@h}11 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Sword Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) piercing damage or {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

trait.name: Phalanx
entries: The soldier has bonus +2 to AC and Attacks, while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two attacks.

action.name: Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} or {@hit 5}(if Phalanx is active) to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d12 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} or {@hit 5}(if Phalanx is active) to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage or {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used by both hands.

action.name: Spiked Grenade
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 10-foot-radius, {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}. {@actSaveFail} 12 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage(magical) plus 6 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and {@condition poisoned}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage without poisoning.
Soldiers are found in many of Ravnica's guilds. The soldier stat block represents a typical member of the rank and file, though weaponry and armor can vary.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage or {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used by both hands.
Bandits are inexperienced ne'er-do-wells who typically follow the orders of higher-ranking bandits.

entries.name: Bandits
entries: {@i Criminals and Scoundrels}

Bandits use the threat of violence to take what they want. Such criminals include gang members, desperadoes, and lawless mercenaries. Yet not all bandits are motivated by greed. Some are driven to lives of crime by unjust laws, desperation, or the threats of merciless leaders.
Roll on or choose a result from the Bandit Motivations table to determine the circumstances behind a bandit's crimes.
I am he who rules the world, don't you know? One little piece at a time.

entries.caption: Bandit Motivations
rows: Fights only oppressors.
Is an ex-soldier who was discarded by their nation and now takes what they were promised.
Is in a gang that views nonmembers as foes.
Hesitantly serves a villainous leader.
Secretly works for a government or a regional ruler to sow chaos.
Takes what they need to survive.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage or {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) if used by both hands.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} The knight is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The knight adds 2 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.
Knights frequently lead troops in combat or work in units that dominate the battlefield. They're often attended by squires, who might be less skilled soldiers or commoners.

entries.name: Knights
entries: {@i Battle Masters and Heroic Wanderers}
Knights are skilled warriors trained for war and tested in battle. Many serve the rulers of a realm, a religion, or an order devoted to a cause.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darvision

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pepper Pouch
entries: Throwing a bag of pepper can temporarily neutralize many opponents. But only those who need to breathe.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Maximus makes two shortsword attacks

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

action.name: Pepper Pouch
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target must succeed in {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, otherwise he will be  {@condition Stunned|XPHB} for 1 minute. The target must repeat the save at the beginning of each turn, ending this state upon success.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The devil's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 10}, {@hit 2} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no materialcan innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Steadfast
entries: The devil can't be {@condition frightened} while it can see an allied creature within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes two attacks: one with its beard and one with its spear.

action.name: Beard
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target can't regain hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) Piercing damage or 8({@dice 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used by both hands

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage or 5({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used by both hands

entries.name: Commoner
entries: {@i Everyday Folk}

Commoners constitute the majority of people who don't pursue magical talents, extraordinary training, or a life of adventure. Some are generous, helpful sorts, while others are more cautious in sharing what they have. Use the following list of jobs and roles to introduce commoners in your adventures:

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the mother's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mother has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The mother of the pack has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the mother of the pack's hounds is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mother makes three Shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Command
entries: Mothers of the Pack can replace one of her attacks to a command for one Hell Hound under her command. Hound who take a command can use one of it's actions Bite or Fire Breath.

reaction.name: Reluctant Bodyguard
entries: When Mother of the Pack take a hit by an attack She can change place with one of her Hell Hounds within 5 feet of the Mother.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke
entries: The cultist casts  {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB} in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

fluff.name: Merregon
entries: The souls of fallen soldiers, mercenaries, and bodyguards who served evil without reservation often find everlasting servitude in the Nine Hells as merregons. These faceless foot soldiers are the Hells' legionnaires, tasked with protecting their infernal plane and its rulers against intruders.

Merregons have no individuality and hence no need for faces. Every merregon legionnaire has a metal mask bolted to its head. Markings on the mask indicate the only elements of the wearer's identity that matter: the commander it serves and the layer of the Nine Hells it protects.

Because of their unshakable loyalty, merregons form the backbone of many devils' protective retinues. They shrink from no task, no matter how dangerous. Unless ordered to fall back, they never retreat from a fight.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mother casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 6}  to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 6}  to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Spickes{@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw}  {@hit 6}  to hit, distance 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 6}  to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Spickes{@recharge 4}
entries: {@atk rw}  {@hit 6}  to hit, distance 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d4 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 7}  to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Spickes
entries: {@atk rw}  {@hit 7}  to hit, distance 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 7}  to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 9({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 8 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spickes
entries: {@atk rw}  {@hit 7}  to hit, distance 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} 9({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 8 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Toxic Vine
entries: Living Sapling attacks now can deal an additional necrotic damage in count of d4s equal to you Proficiency Bonus. Already count in attacks.

trait.name: Life Bond
entries: When you regain Hit Points from a level 1+ spell or Lay-on-Hands ability, the steed regains the same number of Hit Points if you're within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Fiend Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 2} Necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Fell Glare (Fiend Only; Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 13}, one creature within 60 feet the steed can see. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darvision

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Helm of Fright
entries: When Titus hit a creature with a melee attack, he can emit impulse of fright. If he does that target of the attack should make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} of Titus for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this Helm pf Fright ability for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Titus makes two mace attacks

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.
EGD p. 181

trait.name: Confer Fire Resistance
entries: The nightmare can grant {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage to a rider while it is on the nightmare.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The nightmare sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Attacker
entries: The sidekick gains a +2 bonus to all attack rolls.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Fire damage.

action.name: Ethereal Stride
entries: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it teleport to the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane or vice versa.

entries.name: Nightmare
entries: {@i Dread Steed of the Lower Planes}

Nightmares resemble horses with flaming manes, burning hooves, and smoldering eyes. They terrorize weaker creatures and often ally with denizens of the Lower Planes in committing evil acts. These supernatural horses can innately travel between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, and many know the locations of portals to the Lower Planes, the Shadowfell, and other sinister realms.

Nightmares' speed, resilience, and ability to gallop between planes of existence make them steeds coveted by evildoers. Roll on or choose a result from the Nightmare Riders table to inspire what might employ a nightmare steed.

entries.caption: Nightmare Riders
rows: The champion or messenger of an evil deity.
A group of joyriding imps or quasits.
An innocent soul trapped on the wild Fiend.
A lore-hunting mage, cultist, or lich.
A night hag herding larvae between planes.
A wicked cavalier, such as a death knight, an erinyes, an incubus, or a vampire.

item.name: Yggdrasil Glaive
entries: This glaive is formed from several strands of leafy vines that have grown together into the shape of a expertly executed lightwood weapon.
While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
That weapon has four command words. While attuned to the glaive, you can speak one of its command words to cause an effect.

entries.name: Grass
entries: Speaking the {@b first} command word as a bonus action you conjure a thick patch of shrubs, grasses, aboveground roots, and even small saplings in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} around you. The area becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, and the foliage is thick enough to provide {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} against ranged attacks.

entries.name: Growth
entries: Speaking the {@b second} command word as a bonus action causes up to 120 feet of creeping vines to grow from an area touched by effect of the first command word, towards a solid surface, object or creature you can see. The vines grow at a speed of 30 feet per round.

entries.name: Grasp
entries: Speaking the {@b third} command word, costing no action causes the vines to firmly affix themselves to a surface, object or creature within their reach. The vines can only be anchored to one object or surface at a time.

entries.name: Grapple
entries: Speaking the {@b forth} command word as an action causes the vines begin to retract into the place they grew out of after the first command word at a speed of 30 feet per round. If anchored to a solid surface, the vines will pull an area covered with Plants, after the first command word, towards the surface at the same speed. If anchored to an object smaller than a Gargantuan, the vines will pull the object towards an area.

While the vines are extended, they can be attacked. Vines have an Armor Class of 14, Strength score equal to 18, every 5x5 square have a 45 hit points and can bear up to 270 pounds of weight at time. Vines have vulnerability to fire and slashing damage. Weight in excess of this will cause the vines to begin to tear, dealing 10 points of damage to them each round. If the vines drop to 0 hit points, the glaive lost it's magical properties until next dawn.
The plants and vines is permanent unless you speak the first command word again or they being destroyed.
Creature what attuned to the glaive can use first command word number of time equal to its Proficiency Bonus.

item.name: Infernal Glaive
entries: This glaive are made from green infernal metal that's give this weapon formerly owed to Baator's(Nine Hell's) soldier - Bearded Devil ability to ignore piercing, slashing and bludgeoning damage resistance of {@b Fiends} and {@b Celestials}.

entries.name: Infernal Wound
entries: If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 12}. {@actSaveFail} The target receives an infernal wound. While wounded, the target loses 5 ({@dice 1d10}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check.

item.name: Scrying Demon's Shield
entries: This classic iron shield is emblazoned with the skulllike face of a demon with glowing eyes and several glowing fangs in his maw.

The shield has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. When you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you while holding this shield, you can use your reaction to expend 1 of its charges to curse that creature. The next time that creature makes an ability check or attack roll before the end of its next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the total.

entries.name: Curse bound property
entries: {@i Property:} While holding this Shield, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks.
{@i Curse:} If the owner of the shield tries to sneak or hide, the shield will start making a demonic howling that can be heard within a 300-foot radius.

item.name: Lightwood Pike
entries: This magical wooden pike was crafted with a lightweight, but durable wood. It has a versatile property to replace the two-handed property. It lacks the heavy property.

item.name: Staff of Life and Death
entries: Two sides of this staff looks extremely different. First of them is leafy green wood branch and second is dry skeleton like piece of wooden roots. This two sides have separeted source of magical energy. Both of them has 4 charges and regain {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the staff, you can expend any number charges to cast some spell.

entries.caption: Life Side
rows: {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} (but distance is 30 ft)
1 charge per spell level (maximum 4 for a level 4 spell)
{@spell Lesser Restoration|XPHB}

entries.caption: Death Side
rows: {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB} (but distance is 30 ft)
1 charge per spell level (maximum 4 for a level 4 spell)
{@spell Blight|XPHB}

entries.name: Regaining Charges
entries: The every sides of the staff seperatly regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Kruthik Claw Shortsword
entries: This shortsword made from Adult Kruthik's claw by expirienced craftsman. That sword not very handly, but extremely sharp. Cause of that, Kruthik Claw Shortsword has bonus +2 to damage rolls but also has penalty -1 to attack rolls.

entries.name: Siege
entries: This weapon is expremely sharp. Whenever it hits an object made from anything except metal, the hit is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}

entries.name: Kruthik's Fear
entries: Owner of this weapon has an advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks against Kruthiks.

item.name: Tyr's Libra
entries: This Warhammer made as part of Tyr's Altar and has an ideal balance. This weapon give his owner bonus +1 to an attack and damage rolls.
This Warhammer emits a bright light in 5-feet radius and dim light in another 5-feet radius. Owner can use a bonus action to increase radius of every types of light to 15-feet.

entries.name: There-and-Back-Again
entries: This weapon has a Thrown property. Tyr's Libra return in owner hand at the end of his turn.
{@b "Be Fair and you will be Rewarded by Balance"}

item.name: Moon Aegis
entries: This round shield is made of white quartz. The face of the Moon is transferred to its surface with significant details.

Moon Aegis is the divine shield that protect Moon Palace on Arvandor during the Seldarin Wars. After Lolth Falls, Eilistraee inherited the Moon Palace from Sehanine Moonbow. At the end of Seldarin Wars shield loses part of it's power and was transfered to the material plane as mighty artifact of moon deity worshippers
The shield has number of charges equal of owner's Proficiency Bonus and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While owner holding a shield he can use some spells as describer below:

entries.caption: Shield's abilities
rows: {@spell Shield|XPHB}
{@spell Shield of Faith|XPHB} only {@b Self} distance, no need {@variantrule Concentration|XPHB}
{@spell Fount of Moonlight|XPHB} no need {@variantrule Concentration|XPHB}

entries: Except that, owner of the shield while holding it can say a command word to activate special effects:

entries.name: Command Word: "Protect"
entries: The shield gains consciousness and floats around the owner, protecting them. For 10 minutes, the owner gains all the benefits of the shield without having to hold it. Repeating the command stops the shield in place until the owner picks it up, at which point the timer stops.
If the owner moves more than 5 feet away from the stopped shield it will fall to the ground.
All the time spent working in the "protection" mode is restored after the owner finishes a long rest.

entries.name: Command Word: "Repell"
entries: If owner harm by a melee attack he can say a Command Word by a Reaction. After that attacker should make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. If fails he suffering from {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage and {@condition Blind} condition for the end of its turn. If succeed he taken only half amount of damage and not {@condition Blind}.
Owner of the shield can use that Command Word only once per round.

item.name: Thorny Rose
entries: This masterwork pistol covered by silver images of Rose Bushes. Appearence of It is extremely gorgeous and rich.

Thorny Rose is first weapon from group of firearm made by famous gunsmith from Baldur's Gate. Rumors said another weapons named as: Windy Anemone, Icy Snowdrop, Fire Lily, Mighty Lithops, The Creeping Creeper
All these firearm have an ability to shoot by bullets with special effects. Without that specilal bullets it's just a regular +1 Pistol.

entries.name: Thorny Bullet(target)
entries: Target damaged by that type of bullet should make {@actSave con} {@dc 15}.

{@actSaveFail} target start to suffering from Painfull Wound While wounded, the target loses 7 ({@dice 2d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. Also pain from wound so deep so target get a disadvantage on any mental ability checks until wound not closed. The wound closes, after a spell restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|XPHB}) check.
{@actSaveSuccess} target get an additional  6 ({@dice 2d6}) magical piercing damage from an attack.

entries.name: Thorny Bullet(area)
entries: Metal rose bushes with a 5-foot radius grow from the point where the bullet hits. Any creatures in that area should make {@actSave dex} {@dc 13}.

{@actSaveFail} creature get a 7 ({@dice 2d6}) magical piercing damage and {@condition restrained|XPHB}. Until {@condition restrained|XPHB} ends target get a 7 ({@dice 2d6}) magical piercing damage every time when being attacked or trying to attack. Target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to free it from the bushes ended the {@condition restrained|XPHB} condition, doing so by succeeding on a {@dc 13} Stength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check. Target and creature which taken an action get 7 ({@dice 2d6}) magical piercing damage succeeded Athletics check or not.
{@actSaveSuccess} target get only half damage and pushes away from bushes area.

Bushes create by this bullet has 25 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in total, 15 {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}, ressistance to any physical damage and immunity to any magical damage except acid, which they are vulnerable to.
If any creature with size smaller then Huge move throw bushes area it should make {@actSave dex} {@dc 13} as described above for every 5-feet square filled with bushes.
